item.title: A Researcher's Personal Website with Hugo Academic
item.description:
🌐 Why Do Researchers Need a Personal Website?

In today’s academic world, it’s important not only to conduct research but also to publicly share the results. A personal website is a key tool for maintaining an academic presence online. It helps:

  • 🧑‍🔬 Present your biography, publications, projects, and experience
  • 📚 Share materials, presentations, and articles
  • 📬 Stay connected with the academic community and potential collaborators

One of the most popular ways to build such a site is using the Hugo framework with the Academic theme.

🛠 What is Hugo Academic?

Hugo is a static site generator — it’s incredibly fast, doesn’t require a server backend, and is easy to configure. The Academic theme is designed specifically for scholars, teachers, and students.

Advantages of Hugo Academic:

  • 🧩 Structured template tailored for academic content (bio, courses, projects, publications)
  • 🔍 SEO optimization and Google Scholar compatibility
  • 🖼 Support for multilingual content, LaTeX, and math formulas
  • 💼 Ability to publish CV, portfolio, and meeting calendar

🧭 How the Site is Organized

Hugo Academic is structured through YAML files, with each section as a component:

  • content/home/ — configures the homepage
  • content/publication/ — list of publications with abstracts, PDFs, and DOIs
  • content/project/ — descriptions of research projects
  • content/post/ — blog or study notes
  • data/ and config/ — theme, profile, language, and contact settings

📦 Deployment

The site can be hosted on GitHub Pages, Netlify, or any other static hosting platform. All changes are versioned via Git, providing full transparency and control.

🔍 My Experience

In our coursework, we practiced deploying a Hugo Academic site, editing YAML configurations, adding “Education” and “Interests” sections, and writing short posts about our study and project outcomes.

This exercise clearly showed how technical skills integrate with academic self-presentation.

💡 Why It Matters

  • Strengthens academic image
  • Simplifies sharing research outputs with the community
  • Increases visibility of scholarly work

Conclusion: A website built with Hugo Academic is more than a personal page — it’s a professional development tool that unifies research, publications, and academic presence in one place.
